intro: Dalbergaria albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered dalbergia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Dalbergaria albiflora is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
